org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.util

Class Caches

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.core.util.Caches

  • public final class Caches
extends Object
    Caches is a utility class which contains various implementations caches. Some implementations use a Least-Recently-Used policy (LRU) some implementations use SoftReferences or WeakReferences to avoid memory leaks.
    Author:
    dkatzel, jsitz@jcvi.org

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
      The value of this constant is 16.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_CAPACITY

        public static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
        The value of this constant is 16.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • createLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createLRUCache()
        Creates an LRUCache of default capacity. Entries are held in the map until capacity is exceeded.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the (strongly reference) value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity 16.

      • createLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createLRUCache(int maxcapacity)
        Creates an LRUCache of the given max capacity. Entries are held in the map until capacity is exceeded.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the (strongly reference) value type
        Parameters:
        maxcapacity - the max size of this cache before it should start removing the least recently used.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with given capacity

      • createMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createMap()
        Create a map of strong references with an initial default capacity of 16 which CAN GROW if more than that number of entries is inserted. This should have the same semantics as new HashMap<K,V>() .
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the (strongly reference) value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity that can grow if more entries are added just like a normal Map.

      • createMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createMap(int initialSize)
        Create a map of strong references with an initial given capacity which CAN GROW if more than that number of entries is inserted. This should have the same semantics as new HashMap<K,V>() .
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the (strongly reference) value type
        Parameters:
        initialSize - the initial size of the map which can later grow in size as more entries are added.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with the given capacity that can grow if more entries are added just like a normal Map.

      • createSoftReferencedValueLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createSoftReferencedValueLRUCache()
        Creates an LRUCache of default capacity where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a SoftReference. Entries can be removed by 3 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if its value is only weakly reachable AND the garbage collector wants to reclaim memory.
        3. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity

      • createSoftReferencedValueCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createSoftReferencedValueCache()
        Creates an Map of default capacity 16 where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a SoftReference. The size of this map CAN GROW if more entries are inserted. Entries can be removed by 2 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity

      • createSoftReferencedValueCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createSoftReferencedValueCache(int initialCapacity)
        Creates an Map using the given capacity where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a SoftReference. The size of this map CAN GROW if more entries are inserted. Entries can be removed by 2 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - the initialCapacity of this cache which is used to calculate when the map should grow and be re-hashed.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with the given capacity.

      • createSoftReferencedValueLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createSoftReferencedValueLRUCache(int maxSize)
        Creates an LRUCache where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a SoftReference. Entries can be removed by 3 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if its value is only weakly reachable AND the garbage collector wants to reclaim memory.
        3. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the max size of this cache before it should start removing the least recently used.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity

      • createWeakReferencedValueLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createWeakReferencedValueLRUCache()
        Creates an LRUCache with max capacity of 16 where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a WeakReference. Entries can be removed by 3 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if its value is only weakly reachable
        3. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity.

      • createWeakReferencedValueLRUCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createWeakReferencedValueLRUCache(int maxSize)
        Creates an LRUCache where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a WeakReference. Entries can be removed by 3 different ways:
        1. If capacity is exceeded, then the least recently used entry is removed to make room
        2. Any entries may be removed if its value is only weakly reachable
        3. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the max size of this cache before it should start removing the least recently used.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity

      • createWeakReferencedValueCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createWeakReferencedValueCache()
        Creates an LRUCache where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a WeakReference. The size of this map CAN GROW if more entries are inserted. Entries can be removed by 2 different ways:
        1. if its the value is only weakly reachable.
        2. Any entries may be removed if the Map.remove(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the softly referenced value type
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity

      • createWeakReferencedValueCache

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> createWeakReferencedValueCache(int maxSize)
        Creates an LRUCache where the VALUES in the map are each wrapped with a WeakReference. This will allow the map to remove any entries if its value is only weakly reachable.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the (strongly reference) key type
        V - the weakly referenced value type
        Parameters:
        maxSize - the max size of this cache before it should start removing the least recently used.
        Returns:
        a new Map instance with default capacity
